HIV_analysis — HIV analysis operations¶

This module provides HIV analysis operations.

Module Syntax¶

Empty.

Module Contents¶

HIV_analysis.get_HXB2_seq_map(ref_seq)¶
Parameters:ref_seq – HXB2 sequence with gaps
Returns:a dictionary mapping the di columns (starting with 1, ..., N) to the HXB2 sequence (starting with 1, ..., N).
HIV_analysis.map_dca(dca_list, seq_map, seq, seq_dist)¶
Parameters:
  • dca_list – [i,j,di], sorted with respect to di
  • seq_map – maps the di columns (1,...,N) to the sequence positions (1, ..., N)
  • seq – sequence without gaps
  • seq_dist – minimum distance seperating two residues to be relevant
Returns:

a list of list, containing the di columns (1,...,N) which refer to HXB2, the sequence positions (1,...,N) itself, the domain information and the di value.
HIV_analysis.reduce_dca(dca_list, n_dis, include_neighbors)¶
Parameters:
  • dca_list – [*,di,seq_neighbor], sorted with respect to di
  • n_dis – number of di values
  • include_neighbors – include neighbors or not (True/False)
Returns:

a list.
HIV_analysis.filter_dca(dca_list, seq_map, seq, seq_dist, n_dis)¶
Parameters:
  • dca_list – [i,j,di], sorted with respect to di
  • seq_map – maps the di columns (1,...,N) to the sequence positions (1, ..., N)
  • seq – sequence without gaps
  • seq_dist – minimum distance seperating two residues to be relevant
  • n_dis – number of di values to check
Returns:

a list of list, containing the di columns (1,...,N) which refer to HXB2, the sequence positions (1,...,N) itself, the domain information and the di value.
HIV_analysis.map_domain(x)¶
Parameters:x – position in the HXB2 sequence (1,...,N)
HIV_analysis.get_color_for_domain(domain)¶

Docstring missing.
